Package no.brunostengine

package no.brunostengine
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    no.brunostengine.components

  • Class
    Description
    Animation
    The Animation class holds all necessary Frames of an animation that is meant to be played by a GameObject's Animator.
    AssetBuilder
    The AssetBuilder class is meant to provide a method for easier generation of GameObjects.
    AudioHandler
     
    Camera
    The Camera class implements the most important parts of the Player's point of view in-game.
    Direction
    Direction is meant to represent the axes relative to another given object.
    Game
    The Game class holds the most important and low-level functionality, ensuring everything starts correctly.
    GameObject
    Represent any object meant to be present within a scene, whether visible or in the background.
    GameObjectDeserializer
     
    KeyListener
    KeyListener allows for the application to listen to which keys are being pressed at any given moment, can return them through its methods.
    MouseListener
    MouseListener allows for the application to listen to which mouse buttons are being pressed at any given moment, can return them through its methods.
    PoolableObject
    Part of the experimental and unfinished implementation of object pooling system.
    ResourcePool
     
    Scene
    The Scene class is an essential part of the framework, as it represents the in-game world and contains every GameObject meant to be presented to the player or perform actions at any given point.
    SceneBuilder
    The SceneBuilder class is necessary for proper initialization of a Scene.
    Sound
    The Sound class represents any playable track.
    Sprite
    The Sprite class represents the visible image in a Scene.
    SpriteHandler
     
    Spritesheet
    The Spritesheet class represents a list of Sprite objects.
    Tile
    The Tile class represents a single grid-square within a Tilemap instance and contains information where it is located.
    Tilemap
    A tilemap is a way to partition the world or an area into grids, which can then be used to fill with GameObjects.
    Transform
    The Transform class contains information of the position, scale and rotation, as well as its zIndex, of the parent GameObject object it belongs to.
